column1: In those terms I was informed of what my personal concern was with the matter of the Diamond. If you are curious to know what course I took under the circumstances
column2: I beg to inform you that I did what you would probably have done in my place. I modestly declared myself to be quite unequal to the task imposed upon me—and I privately felt
column4: that I was quite clever enough to perform it
column5: if I only gave my own abilities a fair chance. Mr. Franklin
column7: must have seen my private sentiments in my face. He declined to believe in my modesty; and he insisted on giving my abilities a fair chance.Two hours have passed since Mr. Franklin left me. As soon as his back was turned
column8: I went to my writing-desk to start the story.
